intro: Phyllanthus ramiflorus var. samoanus, commonly known as the Samoan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Samoa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that exude a milky sap when damaged. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse morphology and often toxic compounds. It typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in humid, tropical climates. Its unique botanical features make it an important species in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
